title: SafeNet Mentor Curriculum: Digital Literacy & GBV Prevention
description: A comprehensive, trauma-informed curriculum designed to empower girls, women, and community allies with practical digital safety, prevention strategies, survivor-centered response, and healing resources.

modules.title: Introduction & Context
modules.summary: Foundations: what GBV is, trauma-aware language, consent, and why digital literacy matters.

lessons.title: Why This Curriculum Matters
lessons.overview: Set the scene: prevalence, cultural context, and the role of digital spaces in both risk and empowerment.
objectives: Recognize different forms of GBV (physical, sexual, emotional, economic, digital)
Understand basic trauma-informed principles when engaging with survivors
Explain how digital tools can both help and harm safety
activities: Icebreaker: personal safety map (private reflection)
Group discussion prompt: local examples where technology helped or harmed safety

quiz.q: Which of these is NOT a form of GBV?

lessons.reflection_prompt: Write one way technology has affected your or a friend's safety (private).
lessons.facilitator_tips: Create a safe space; remind participants they can skip sharing personal stories.

lessons.title: Trauma-informed Care & Consent
lessons.overview: Principles of listening, non-judgmental support, and informed consent for disclosure.
objectives: Apply basic trauma-informed language
Practice active listening and safe referral steps
Recognize when immediate help is needed
activities: Role-play: supportive listening (in pairs)
Quick checklist: what NOT to say to a survivor
lessons.reflection_prompt: How will you change the way you listen to someone who discloses harm?
lessons.facilitator_tips: Offer private support options and list local referral services.

modules.title: Digital Safety & Privacy
modules.summary: Practical, easy-to-follow steps to protect devices, accounts, and personal information online.

lessons.title: Account Hygiene & Device Safety
lessons.overview: Passwords, updates, device locks, and two-factor authentication (2FA).
objectives: Set strong unique passwords
Enable 2FA where possible
Understand software updates and device locks
activities: Hands-on: check a device's privacy settings (guided)
Create a memorable passphrase exercise

quiz.q: Which is the strongest password option?

lessons.reflection_prompt: When was the last time you updated your device or passwords?
lessons.facilitator_tips: Offer a quiet corner to set up 2FA for participants who want help.

lessons.title: Dealing with Harassment & Privacy Breaches
lessons.overview: Blocking, reporting, preserving digital evidence, and safe steps to protect privacy after harassment.
objectives: Take immediate steps to stop contact
Collect and store evidence safely
Access reporting tools and support services
activities: Scenario: create a safe evidence log (screenshots, timestamps)
Practice: safely block and report on a sample platform

resources.label: How to report on common platforms

quiz.q: What should you do first if someone is threatening you online?

lessons.reflection_prompt: Identify one contact or service you would reach out to if you were harassed online.
lessons.facilitator_tips: Respect privacy; do not ask participants to share screenshots publicly.

modules.title: Healthy Relationships, Consent & Boundaries
modules.summary: Practical skills to recognize healthy vs unhealthy dynamics and communicate consent and boundaries.

lessons.title: Consent & Respect
lessons.overview: Clear definitions of consent, examples, and practicing clear communication.
objectives: Define consent clearly
Practice asking for and giving consent
Identify boundary-setting language
activities: Role-play consent scenarios
Create boundary scripts for common situations
lessons.reflection_prompt: Think of one boundary you want to practice setting this week.
lessons.facilitator_tips: Keep role-plays short and debrief gently.

lessons.title: Recognizing Coercion and Power Imbalance
lessons.overview: How to spot coercive tactics and support those affected without judgement.
objectives: Identify coercive behaviors
Support survivors without pressuring them
Refer to local services appropriately
activities: Case study: identify red flags
Create a non-judgmental referral script
lessons.reflection_prompt: What would make it easier for someone in your community to seek help?
lessons.facilitator_tips: Share local referral contacts and ensure participants know confidentiality limits.

modules.title: Personal Safety Planning & Prevention
modules.summary: Develop personalized safety plans, recognize warning signs early, and build protective networks.

lessons.title: Creating Your Safety Plan
lessons.overview: Step-by-step guide to developing a personal safety plan tailored to your situation and community.
objectives: Identify trusted contacts and safe places
Document emergency contacts and resources
Create code words for danger signals
Plan safe exit routes and communication strategies
activities: Workbook: fill out personal safety plan template
Buddy system: pair up to review safety plans
Resource mapping: locate local services on a map
lessons.reflection_prompt: Who are three trusted people you can contact if you feel unsafe?
lessons.facilitator_tips: Encourage participants to keep their plans private and accessible (phone, email, trusted friend).

lessons.title: Early Warning Signs & Intervention
lessons.overview: Recognize patterns of controlling behavior early and intervene safely before violence escalates.
objectives: Identify red flags in relationships
Spot manipulation and isolation tactics
Intervene safely as a friend or community member
Know when to escalate to professional help
activities: Red flag checklist: interactive scenario review
Intervention scripts: practice safe ways to talk to a concerned friend
Community watch planning: discuss buddy systems

quiz.q: A red flag for unhealthy relationships is when a partner:
options: Monitors all communication and isolates you from friends

lessons.reflection_prompt: Think of a time you noticed an unhealthy relationship pattern. How can you support that person?
lessons.facilitator_tips: Emphasize that supporting someone means respecting their autonomy and offering help, not forcing action.

modules.title: Bystander Intervention & Community Care
modules.summary: Learn how to safely intervene, support survivors, and build caring communities that prevent violence.

lessons.title: The 4 D's of Safe Intervention
lessons.overview: Direct, Distract, Delegate, and Delay—safe ways to intervene when you witness potential harm.
objectives: Understand the 4 D's framework
Practice safe intervention in scenarios
Know your limits and when to involve professionals
Support survivors after witnessing harm
activities: Scenario role-plays: practice each D in different situations
Debrief: what worked and what didn't
Group discussion: cultural norms and safe intervention

quiz.q: If you see someone in danger, a safe intervention might be to:
options: Distract by asking everyone to move somewhere safe

lessons.reflection_prompt: What has stopped you from intervening in the past? What would help you step in next time?
lessons.facilitator_tips: Emphasize safety first—interventions that put bystanders or survivors at more risk are not safe.

lessons.title: Supporting Survivors with Care
lessons.overview: How to show up for survivors: listening, believing, and connecting them to resources.
objectives: Practice supportive listening
Avoid re-traumatization through insensitive questions
Connect survivors to appropriate resources
Take care of your own emotional well-being as a supporter
activities: Role-play: practicing supportive language
Do's and Don'ts: interactive checklist
Self-care for supporters: brief wellness discussion
lessons.reflection_prompt: How do you take care of yourself when supporting someone through trauma?
lessons.facilitator_tips: Normalize caregiver stress and encourage boundaries.

modules.title: Legal Rights, Reporting Options & Justice
modules.summary: Overview of legal options, reporting pathways, rights as a survivor, and navigating the justice system.

lessons.title: Your Legal Rights
lessons.overview: Know your rights as a survivor or witness: confidentiality, legal protections, and recourse options.
objectives: Understand basic legal definitions and rights
Know what protection orders are and how to obtain one
Recognize criminal vs civil justice pathways
Identify legal aid resources in your area
activities: Q&A with legal expert or recorded video
Review local laws handout
Discuss myths vs facts about the legal system

quiz.q: A protection order is used to:
options: Legally prevent contact and enforce penalties for violation

lessons.reflection_prompt: What concerns do you have about the legal system? How can those be addressed?
lessons.facilitator_tips: Invite a local lawyer or legal advocate to co-facilitate if possible.

lessons.title: Reporting & Investigation Process
lessons.overview: What happens when you report to police, medical professionals, or other authorities.
objectives: Understand confidential vs mandatory reporting
Know what to expect in an investigation
Document evidence safely
Access support throughout the process
activities: Timeline: walk through reporting and investigation steps
Evidence preservation tips: practical checklist
Q&A: address fears and misconceptions
lessons.reflection_prompt: What would make reporting safer and easier for survivors in your community?
lessons.facilitator_tips: Emphasize that reporting is a survivor's choice, not an obligation.

modules.title: Mental Health, Healing & Long-Term Recovery
modules.summary: Understand trauma responses, access mental health support, and build resilience for long-term healing.

lessons.title: Understanding Trauma & Healing
lessons.overview: What trauma is, common trauma responses, and evidence-based healing pathways.
objectives: Recognize trauma responses as normal reactions to abnormal events
Understand different healing modalities (therapy, support groups, community healing)
Reduce shame and self-blame
Identify personal healing needs and preferences
activities: Psychoeducation: how trauma affects the brain and body
Grounding exercises: practice calming techniques
Healing modalities review: find what resonates

quiz.q: A trauma response like anxiety or dissociation is:

lessons.reflection_prompt: What does healing mean to you? What support would help you heal?
lessons.facilitator_tips: Normalize all trauma responses; encourage self-compassion.

lessons.title: Accessing Mental Health & Community Support
lessons.overview: Find therapy, support groups, hotlines, and culturally-appropriate healing resources.
objectives: Identify types of mental health support available
Know how to access therapy and crisis support
Explore peer support and community healing options
Build a personal support network
activities: Resource mapping: local therapy, support groups, hotlines
Insurance/payment options: discuss accessibility
Virtual vs in-person: discuss preferences and access
lessons.reflection_prompt: Who is already in your support network? Who would you like to add?
lessons.facilitator_tips: Provide local, specific resources; discuss barriers to access (cost, language, transportation).

modules.title: Immediate Response to Crisis & Recovery Steps
modules.summary: Steps for immediate safety, medical and legal options, and establishing long-term recovery.

lessons.title: Immediate Safety & Medical Response
lessons.overview: How to prioritize safety, secure care, and document injuries while respecting survivor choice.
objectives: Create an emergency plan
Know how to access local medical services
Understand evidence preservation basics
activities: Create a personalised emergency plan
Map local safe services (clinic, police, shelters)
lessons.reflection_prompt: List two trusted people you can contact in an emergency.
lessons.facilitator_tips: Provide private referral options and avoid pressuring disclosure.

lessons.title: Long-term Recovery & Community Support
lessons.overview: Mental health supports, peer groups, legal aid options, and economic empowerment resources.
objectives: Identify local support services
Access mental health and peer support resources
Explore safe economic supports
activities: Plan for next steps: what support would you want?
Create a personal recovery roadmap
lessons.reflection_prompt: What is one small step you can take towards recovery this month?
lessons.facilitator_tips: Share optional follow-up group sessions and remote support options.

accessibility.notes: All lesson content includes audio narration, large-text PDFs, and simplified summaries for low-literacy learners.
